q5 module¶

q5.normalize(data, minI, maxI, minO, maxO)¶

Attempts to improve an image by stretching the range of intensity values it contains to make full use of possible values Following formula is used to perform constract strecting.

s = (s-c)*(b-a)/(d-c) + a (linear mapping so get equation of a straight line)

where s = new constract value These lower and upper limits will be called a and b, respectively (for standard 8-bit grayscale pictures, these limits are usually 0 and 255) The value limits (lower = c, upper = d) in the unmodified picture

Parameters

  • data (ndarray) – numpy array of image

  • minI (int) – lower limit of unmodified data

  • maxI (int) – upper limit of unmodified data

  • minO (int) – lower limit of standard picture which is 0

  • maxO (int) – upper limit of standard picture which is 255

Returns

normalized numpy ndarray.

Return type

ndarray

Lab Assignment 6
